banner.title: AI Infrastructure for Global Transaction Transparency
banner.description: Powered by Google Gemini technology and integrated with banks and crypto platforms worldwide, our system provides real-time visibility into fund movements, risk scoring, and automated compliance actions.

about.title: Understanding the Platform
about.paragraph1: The system combines large-scale financial data modeling, behavioral analytics, and regulatory intelligence to interpret the flow of money across connected accounts and digital assets.
about.paragraph2: It operates as a neutral analytical layer ‚Äî securely connected to financial institutions through verified APIs, providing structured insight into every transaction chain and its associated risk.

intelligence.title: Intelligence

integrity.title: Integrity

analysis.title: Analysis
analysis.text: Processes multi-channel financial data and identifies irregular activity using Gemini's contextual understanding.

risk.title: Risk Evaluation
risk.text: Applies AI-driven scoring and behavioral clustering to determine exposure to fraud, unauthorized use, or compliance breach.

response.title: Automated Response
response.text: When risk thresholds are reached, the system can initiate authorized procedures ‚Äî including chargeback, recall, or dispute actions ‚Äî directly through institutional APIs.

benefit.title: Access and Regulatory Framework
benefit.item1: Because the platform interacts with live financial networks, access is granted only after completion of a short compliance onboarding required by global regulators.
benefit.item2: This ensures lawful data exchange, verified identity, and full accountability of every operation executed through the AI infrastructure.
benefit.footer: Compliance is not an add-on ‚Äî it's an integral part of the system design.

transparency.title: Designed for Transparency, Built for Trust
transparency.text1: The platform helps institutions and individuals detect irregular financial behavior, reduce exposure to fraud, and maintain full visibility over both fiat and digital transactions.
transparency.text2: It functions as a permanent monitoring layer that ensures each movement of value is traceable, explainable, and compliant.
transparency.box1: Real-time transaction interpretation across financial networks
transparency.box2: Automated compliance checks and incident reporting
transparency.box4: Structured traceability for regulators and users alike

hero.title: Gemini-Powered Financial Intelligence Architecture
hero.description: The system is powered by Google Gemini's multimodal AI framework ‚Äî an infrastructure capable of analyzing structured and unstructured financial data at scale. Combined with proprietary risk and compliance logic, it enables continuous monitoring, contextual reasoning, and secure interaction with financial institutions and blockchain ecosystems.
hero.summary: At its core, the platform transforms complex transaction data into transparent, regulator-ready insights.

architecture.title: System Architecture
architecture.description: The technology stack is organized into five interconnected layers, each dedicated to a specific stage of financial data processing ‚Äî from secure ingestion to regulatory action.

data.title: Data Sources
data.text: Read-only access to banks, payment processors, and crypto exchanges via verified APIs. Supports Open Banking, ISO 20022, and blockchain data streams.

gemini.title: Gemini AI Core
gemini.text: Processes high-volume financial data using Gemini's multimodal reasoning capabilities. Performs natural-language interpretation of metadata, behavioral clustering, and entity correlation across accounts.

risk.title: Risk Engine
risk.text: Executes machine learning‚Äìbased scoring logic that identifies anomalies, duplicate transfers, hidden subscriptions, and unauthorized activity. Each chain of transactions receives a dynamic risk profile updated in real time.

compliance.title: Compliance Layer
compliance.text: Implements AML, KYC, GDPR, and regional data-protection standards. Ensures traceability and accountability of every decision generated by the AI. Provides audit logs compatible with regulatory review formats.

response.title: Response API Gateway
response.text: Acts as a secure communication channel between the platform and financial institutions. Authorized by compliance rules, it can initiate chargeback, recall, or dispute procedures when confirmed irregularities are detected.

secureData.title: Secure Data Handling
secureData.description:
All connected data flows operate in read-only mode.
The platform does not execute or store financial operations; it only interprets and reports them.

accordion.title: Security measures:
accordion.text:
‚Ä¢ TLS 1.3 and AES-256 end-to-end encryption
‚Ä¢ Differential privacy in all data aggregation processes
‚Ä¢ Region-based data segregation (EU / NA / APAC)

geminiRisk.title: Gemini Cognitive Risk Engine
geminiRisk.description: Using Gemini's reasoning capabilities, the platform interprets financial behavior not only through numerical anomalies, but also through semantic patterns ‚Äî e.g. metadata, transaction descriptions, and behavioral correlations.

accordion.title: Capabilities:
accordion.text:
‚Ä¢ Continuous anomaly detection across fiat and crypto ecosystems
‚Ä¢ Behavior-based fraud scoring (0‚Äì100 scale)
‚Ä¢ Contextual understanding of transaction purpose and counterpart behavior

intelligentAction.description: When the AI identifies high-risk financial behavior, it prepares a structured incident report and ‚Äî within the regulatory boundaries ‚Äî triggers automated responses through partner APIs:

accordion.title: All actions are logged, timestamped, and approved within the compliance layer before execution.
accordion.text:

‚Ä¢ Exchange dispute / refund submissions for fraudulent digital-asset activity
‚Ä¢ Regulatory incident report generated for audit and supervision

accordion.title: Features:

privacy.intro1: This Privacy Policy explains how TraceNet Systems Ltd. ("TraceNet," "we," "our," or "the Company") collects, uses, protects, and discloses personal and financial data processed through our platform and related services.
privacy.intro2: Our mission is to enable financial transparency and security through AI-driven data intelligence, while maintaining strict compliance with international data-protection and financial-regulatory laws.

scope.title: 1. Scope and Application
scope.description1: This Policy applies to all users of TraceNet's platform ‚Äî including individuals, businesses, and institutional partners ‚Äî and covers data processed through:
scope.list2: API integrations with banks, payment providers, and crypto exchanges;
scope.list3: Customer support, onboarding, and communication channels.
scope.description2: It also applies to employees, contractors, and affiliates acting on behalf of TraceNet in processing user data.

data.title: 2. Data We Collect
data.description: We collect only the data necessary to operate our services, ensure compliance, and improve system performance.

userData.title: 2.1 Data Provided by Users
userData.list1: Identity and contact details provided during compliance onboarding (e.g., full name, email address, institution, verification documents).
userData.list2: Account connection metadata (API keys, institution IDs ‚Äî tokenized and encrypted).
userData.list3: User consent records and compliance declarations.

autoData.title: 2.2 Data Collected Automatically
autoData.list1: Technical information (IP address, device type, browser configuration, session time).
autoData.list2: API call metadata and system performance logs.
autoData.list3: Anonymized financial data retrieved via read-only connections.

sensitive.title: 2.3 Sensitive Financial Data
sensitive.text1: When connecting with banks or exchanges, TraceNet retrieves only read-only transactional data.
sensitive.text2: We never store authorization credentials, passwords, or payment instruments.

usage.title: 3. How We Use Data
usage.list1: Operate, maintain, and improve the platform;
usage.list2: Analyze transaction activity and detect potential fraud or irregular behavior;
usage.list3: Generate anonymized analytical and compliance reports;
usage.list4: Communicate with users and provide technical or regulatory support;
usage.list6: Enhance the accuracy of our AI-based analytical models.
usage.note: TraceNet does not sell or share data for marketing or advertising purposes.

legalBasis.title: 4. Legal Basis for Processing
legalBasis.description: Data is processed under one or more of the following legal bases:
legalBasis.list1: User consent ‚Äî explicit authorization to connect financial accounts or submit verification data;
legalBasis.list2: Legitimate interest ‚Äî fraud detection, data security, and service improvement;
legalBasis.list3: Legal obligation ‚Äî compliance with AML/KYC and data-retention laws;
legalBasis.list4: Contractual necessity ‚Äî enabling user access and platform functionality.

retention.title: 5. Data Retention
retention.description: Data is retained only for as long as necessary to:
retention.list3: Resolve disputes or enforce contractual obligations.
retention.note: Once no longer required, data is securely deleted or irreversibly anonymized.

security.title: 6. Data Security

security.list1: AES-256 and TLS 1.3 encryption for data at rest and in transit;
security.list2: Multi-region data hosting with restricted access controls;
security.list3: Continuous penetration testing and vulnerability monitoring;
security.list4: Immutable audit logs for all access and data operations.
security.note: All integrations are read-only and compliant with ISO 27001, SOC 2 Type II, and Open Banking PSD2 standards.

sharing.list1: Financial institutions and exchanges ‚Äî to process authorized analytical or recall/dispute requests.
sharing.list2: Regulatory authorities ‚Äî when legally required for compliance with AML, KYC, or supervisory obligations.
sharing.list3: Infrastructure providers ‚Äî for hosting, compliance monitoring, or auditing, under confidentiality agreements.
sharing.note: TraceNet never discloses user data for commercial resale, behavioral profiling, or advertising.

transfers.title: 8. International Data Transfers
transfers.description: Where data is transferred internationally, TraceNet applies appropriate safeguards, including:
transfers.list2: Regional data storage for EU, UK, and Canadian users;
transfers.list3: Encryption and pseudonymization prior to transfer.
transfers.note: Our primary data-processing centers are located in the European Union, United Kingdom, Canada, and Israel.

rights.list5: Withdraw consent at any time without affecting prior lawful processing.

what.text1: Cookies are small text files that are stored on your device (computer, tablet, or smartphone) when you visit a website.
what.text2: They help websites recognize your device, remember your preferences, and improve your user experience.
what.text3: Cookies may also be used for analytics, performance tracking, and ‚Äî where permitted ‚Äî marketing and advertising purposes.

usage.title: 2. How We Use Cookies
usage.list1: Ensure the proper functioning of our website;
usage.list2: Remember user preferences and language settings;
usage.list3: Improve the performance, speed, and usability of our site;
usage.list4: Collect anonymous usage statistics to help us improve our services;
usage.list6: (If consented) enable analytics and advertising integrations.
usage.note: We do not use cookies to store sensitive financial or personal information.

necessary.title: 3.1 Strictly Necessary Cookies
necessary.text1: These cookies are essential for the website to function properly and cannot be disabled.
necessary.text2: They include session identifiers, authentication tokens, and security-related cookies.

functional.title: 3.2 Functional Cookies

duration.title: 4. Duration of Cookies
duration.list1: Session cookies ‚Äî deleted when you close your browser; or
duration.list2: Persistent cookies ‚Äî remain on your device until they expire or are manually deleted.
duration.note: We retain cookies only as long as necessary for their intended purpose, usually between 1 day and 12 months.
